columns.name: outcomeIndicator
constraints: Ramsar - Control of pest, predator and competitor species
Ramsar - Decrease in inappropriate land management practices within the catchment area
Ramsar - Creation or enhancement of ecological niches
Ramsar - Increase in recruitment/survival of plants/food sources
Ramsar - Stabilised or improved water quality
Ramsar - Restoration of hydrology to more natural regimes
Threatened species - Control of pest, predator and competitor species
Threatened species - Disease threats contained, reduced or excluded
Threatened species - Increased area of suitable habitat
Threatened species - Improved quality of habitat
Threatened species - Protection of existing populations
Threatened species - Enhancement of wild populations with re-introductions
World heritage - Control of pest, predator and competitor species
World heritage - Disease threats contained, reduced or excluded
World heritage - Reduction or halting of inappropriate fire regimes
World heritage - Reduction of the unsustainable use of land within or surrounding the property
World heritage - Stabilisation or improvement of nutrient levels
Threatened Ecological Community - Control of pest, predator and competitor species
Threatened Ecological Community - Disease threats contained, reduced or excluded
Threatened Ecological Community - Improved/increased faunal habitat values or related floral features
Threatened Ecological Community - Increased area of relevant vegetation types
Threatened Ecological Community - Improved connectivity between patches
Threatened Ecological Community - Improved projected foliage cover of over-storey
Threatened Ecological Community - Improved composition and cover of understorey
Sustainable agriculture - Increase in knowledge and awareness among landholders of sustainable agricultural practices.
Sustainable agriculture - Increase in knowledge and awareness among landholders of the tools, technologies and practices which improve climate resilience.
Sustainable agriculture - Increase in knowledge and awareness among landholders of the tools, technologies and practices which improve market access based on sustainability credentials.

value: Improving market access opportunities through sustainability credentials
Loss of critical ecosystem service supporting habitat
Changes to hydrology and aquatic systems
Spread of weeds from surrounding areas
Lack of protection for ecological assets during fire control activities
Possible infection of disease free areas
Lack of strategic and statutory planning consideration for ecological assets
Improving market access opportunities through sustainability credentials

columns.name: keyInterventions
constraints: Agreement establishment - on-title in-perpetuity conservation covenant
Agreement establishment - wildfire prevention/response management prescriptions to protect species or ecological communities e.g. alpine bogs
Agreement establishment - land management agreement (10 years +)
Agreement establishment - pest animal management or weed management agreement
Agreement establishment - conservation agreement (other than covenant)
Communication, education and awareness raising - further applied research
Communication, education and awareness raising - hard communication material (eg. Signage)
Communication, education and awareness raising - soft communication material (eg. Video, field guide, newsletters, websites, emails, social media)
Communication, education and awareness raising - training for climate change adaptation (or another topic)
Community/stakeholder engagement - voluntary conservation activities (eg. tree planting)
Community/stakeholder engagement - farmer discussion groups, peer to peer learning
Community/stakeholder engagement - formation and ongoing support for landholder groups
Community/stakeholder engagement - negotiation with the community, landholders, farmers, Traditional Owner groups, agriculture industry groups
Community/stakeholder engagement - reference group/steering group/working group
Community/stakeholder engagement - support communities of practice
Habitat augmentation - nestbox installation/artificial  tree hollow/'stag' tree creation
Habitat augmentation - vegetation corridor/patch establishment to improve connectivity
Habitat augmentation - increased seed collection and storage
Habitat augmentation - instream habitat improvement eg. Log/snag reinstatement, fish 'hotels'
Habitat improvement/regeneration - erosion control and prevention
Habitat improvement/regeneration - grazing management to improve groundcover
Hydrology improvement/remediation - barrier removal and natural flow/tidal movement re-instated
Planning - development of farm/project/site management plan
Planning - improved species or ecological community conservation management
Planning - improved coastal, estuary or nearshore marine management
Species management - emergency interventions to prevent extinction
Species management - establishing and maintaining captive breeding programs
Support development of market access plans, opportunities
Support uptake of new tools and technologies - climate adaptation
Support uptake of new tools and technologies - market access
Support uptake of new tools and technologies - sustainable agriculture
Support use of weather and climate adaptation information
Supporting the capacity of Indigenous land groups

columns.description: SMART outcome being reported against, as per the MERI Plan.
columns.name: shortTermAchieved

columns.description: SMART outcome being reported against, as per the MERI Plan.
columns.name: mediumTermAchieved

items.source: Please complete the questions in this form for each short term outcome statement in the project MERI plan

items.preLabel: 1. Outcome Statement

items.source:
2. Investment priorities - indicators, threats and interventions

For each investment priority relevant to this project outcome, please answer the following questions. You can add another investment priority using the button at the end of the investment priority questions.

  • Select an investment priority
  • Select the relevant outcome indicator
  • Select key threats
  • Select additional threats
  • Select key agricultural categories
  • Select project services, activities or interventions
  • Can you quantify the level of achievement > Yes >

items.preLabel: Investment priority
Outcome indicator
Key project service, intervention or activity
Additional services, interventions or activities
Can you quantify the level of achievement of your outcome statement against a baseline?

items.source: What level of change has been achieved against the project baseline?

items.preLabel: Effectiveness
Efficiency
Legacy
Appropriateness
Explain why not

items.source:
3. What data supports the response to Question 2?

Provide a data summary for each data set that supports your selected level of change against a baseline in Question 2. Each of your outcome statements and investment priority/s will have a data set or data sets. Only provide a summary for data sets collected under the outcome statement selected in Question 1 and the investment priority/s relevant to that outcome statement. You can provide data sets from multiple sources to support your level of change.

items.preLabel: 4. To what extent were the Program Logic assumptions underpinning the outcome statement accurate and/or inaccurate?
5. What have been the key enablers to achieving this outcome statement?
6. What have been the key barriers to achieving this outcome statement?
KEQ1 - To what extent are you progressing towards the medium-term outcomes of the program?
KEQ2 - How and to what extent has the project increased knowledge of best practice NRM for the investment priority?
KEQ3 - Were the methods/strategies used the best way to achieve/maximise the outcomes or are there other methods/strategies that might be more effective?
KEQ4 - To what extent has the project risk assessment and risk management been appropriate and effective?

KEQ5 - If your project engages with Traditional Owners, how and by what means has this project improved the capacity of Traditional Owners to lead or assist with the management of the investment priority?
KEQ6 - Have there been any unexpected or unintended (positive or negative) changes or other outcomes delivered by this project and what are they?
KEQ7 - What elements of the project could be improved to maximise efficiency (and value for money)?
KEQ8 - Did this project receive funding from any other sources apart from the RLP Program? If yes, please specify and the proportion of funding contributed to the project.
KEQ9 - How and to what extent has the project achieved the desired behavioural change and ongoing commitment among the participating land managers towards the investment priority?
KEQ10 - What evidence is there that the outcomes will be maintained? How will they be maintained and by whom?
KEQ11 - Is there any additional information or data you wish to provide that you have used to evaluate the success of the project?
Project Case study
items.placeHolder: Provide a brief description of your project and its major achievements
